completion:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: February 28, 2024 CC Referred Physician: Dr. House

INDICATION FOR OPERATION Richard Garcia is a 64-year-old female who presents with airway stenosis.
The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
The patient wished to proceed and informed consent was obtained.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.
Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate.
Consent was signed and witnessed by an assisting medical professional.
PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

PROCEDURE

31645 Therapeutic aspiration initial episode 

31625 Endobronchial Biopsy(s) 

31636 Dilate and bronchial stent initial bronchus 

31641 Destruction of tumor OR relief of stenosis by any method other than excision (eg. laser therapy, cryotherapy) 

ATTENDING Dr. Chen

ASSISTANT Dr. Smith

SUPPORT STAFF RN: Jessica RN RT: Tom RT

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.
INSTRUMENTATION Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; Flexible Hybrid (Pedatric) Bronchoscope.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).
Initial Airway Inspection There were significant stenosis noted at the LUL orifice.
Mild stenosis was noted at the Right Mainstem (RMS).
Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the airways from mucus.
Right Mainstem Interventions Endobronchial obstruction at the Right Mainstem (RMS) was treated with the following modalities:


Electrocautery: Needle knife, Effect 4, 40W, was used to make 2-3 second radial cuts.
Biopsy: Endobronchial biopsy was performed at the Right Mainstem. The lesion was successfully removed and samples were sent for Pathology.
Balloon Dilation: A 10/11/12 Elation balloon was used to perform dilation to 12 mm at the Right Mainstem.
Total 1 inflation with dilation time of 60 seconds.

Result: Prior to treatment, the affected airway was noted to be 70% patent.
After treatment, the airway was 100% patent.

LUL orifice Interventions Endobronchial obstruction at the LUL orifice was treated with the following modalities:


Electrocautery: Needle knife, Effect 4, 40W, was used to make 2-3 second radial cuts.
Balloon Dilation: A 4/5/6 Elation balloon was used to perform dilation to 8 mm at the LUL Carina (Lc2).
Total 1 inflation with dilation time of 60 seconds.


Stent Placement: The following stent (Aero 10x15) was placed in the LUL orifice.
Result: Prior to treatment, the affected airway was noted to be 15% patent. After treatment, the airway was 100% patent.
The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.
SPECIMENS

Right Mainstem Biopsy - Pathology 

IMPRESSION/PLAN

Richard Garcia is a 64-year-old female who presents for bronchoscopy for airway stenosis.
Follow up in 2 weeks for repeat bronchoscopy.

Await final pathology results.

DATE OF PROCEDURE: February 28, 2024 CC Referred Physician: Dr. House

INDICATION FOR OPERATION William Jones is a 52-year-old male who presents with airway stenosis.
The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
The patient wished to proceed and informed consent was obtained.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.
Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate.
Consent was signed and witnessed by an assisting medical professional.
PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J95.850 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J95.850 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

PROCEDURE

31645 Therapeutic aspiration initial episode 

31625 Endobronchial Biopsy(s) 

31636 Dilate and bronchial stent initial bronchus 

31641 Destruction of tumor OR relief of stenosis by any method other than excision (eg. laser therapy, cryotherapy) 

ATTENDING Dr. Weiss

ASSISTANT Dr. Lee

SUPPORT STAFF RN: Mike RN RT: Lisa RT

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.
INSTRUMENTATION Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; Flexible Hybrid (Pedatric) Bronchoscope.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).
Initial Airway Inspection There were significant stenosis noted at the RUL orifice.
Mild stenosis was noted at the Left Mainstem (LMS) and Carina.
Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the airways from mucus.
Left Mainstem Interventions Endobronchial obstruction at the Left Mainstem (LMS) and Carina was treated with the following modalities:


Electrocautery: Needle knife, Effect 4, 40W, was used to make 2-3 second radial cuts.
Biopsy: Endobronchial biopsy was performed at the Left Mainstem. The lesion was successfully removed and samples were sent for Pathology.
Balloon Dilation: A 10/11/12 Elation balloon was used to perform dilation to 14 mm at the Left Mainstem.
Total 1 inflation with dilation time of 60 seconds.

Result: Prior to treatment, the affected airway was noted to be 75% patent.
After treatment, the airway was 100% patent.

RUL orifice Interventions Endobronchial obstruction at the RUL orifice was treated with the following modalities:


Electrocautery: Needle knife, Effect 4, 40W, was used to make 2-3 second radial cuts.
Balloon Dilation: A 4/5/6 Elation balloon was used to perform dilation to 10 mm at the RUL Carina (Rc1).
Total 1 inflation with dilation time of 60 seconds.


Stent Placement: The following stent (Silicone 10x10) was placed in the RUL orifice.
Result: Prior to treatment, the affected airway was noted to be 10% patent. After treatment, the airway was 100% patent.
The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.
SPECIMENS

Left Mainstem Biopsy - Pathology 

IMPRESSION/PLAN

William Jones is a 52-year-old male who presents for bronchoscopy for airway stenosis.
Follow up in 2 weeks for repeat bronchoscopy.

Await final pathology results.

prompt: Please generate a procedure note for Dr. Dr. Patel. Patient is James Smith, 56 year old female. Diagnosis J95.850. We treated stenosis in the RUL orifice with a Aero 10x15 stent and balloon dilation. We also treated mild stenosis in the Left Mainstem (LMS) and Carina with dilation and biopsy. Pre-treatment patency was 20% at the severe site and 70% at the mild site. All post-treatment patency 100%.
